metrics.name: PO Item changes rate
metrics.description: Percentage of cases with PO Item changes
metrics.signalFragment:
COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
	WHERE (event_name MATCHES(${po_change_event_flow})))
	/
	COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
	WHERE (event_name MATCHES(${po_creation_events}))
	)
	* 100
    
    -- ILIKE '%Update%'

metrics.name: Percent of cases affected by rework
metrics.description: Number of cases affected by rework divided by the total number of cases

metrics.name: Late deliveries net value
metrics.description: Net order value of cases with late deliveries. Only cases that have been completely delivered are considered.

metrics.name: Days Payables Outstanding
metrics.description: Days Payables Outstanding - Average time from invoice posting to invoice clearing within a reference period
metrics.signalFragment:
AVG(
	(SELECT LAST(${itp_clearing_date}) 
		WHERE ((NOW() - LAST(end_time)) < DURATION ${itp_invoice_clearing_period}))
	-(SELECT LAST(${itp_posting_date})
		WHERE ((NOW() - LAST(end_time)) < DURATION ${itp_invoice_posting_period})))

metrics.name: Cancellation rate of purchase orders_1
metrics.description: Percentage of cases with cancelled purchase order items
metrics.signalFragment:
COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
	WHERE (SELECT FIRST(event_name) FILTER (
			WHERE event_name IN (${po_item_cancellation_events}))) IS NOT NULL
	)
/ COUNT(case_id)
* 100

metrics.name: Volume of cancelled orders
metrics.description: Volume of orders in USD that have been cancelled

metrics.name: Invoices without goods receipt
metrics.description: Total number of invoices without goods receipts
metrics.signalFragment:
COUNT(case_id)
	FILTER (WHERE NOT EVENT_NAME  MATCHES (${itp_goods_receipt_events})
		AND EVENT_NAME  MATCHES (${itp_invoice_posting_events}))

metrics.name: Invoices waiting for Goods Receipt
metrics.description: Total number of cases with Invoices waiting for the Goods Receipt event
metrics.signalFragment:
COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
	WHERE NOT (event_name MATCHES(${goods_receipt_events}))
	AND (event_name MATCHES(${invoice_receipt_event_flow}))
	)

children.name: Case Table
Cases with Contract Reference
Conformance (PO Creation to PO Release > 3 Days)
Summary

blocks.text: 41,796 POs have been released.
19,217 POs have taken more than 3 days from PO Creation to PO Release.
The POs taking more than 3 days from PO Creation to PO Release have a total PO value of INR 31 Billion.
Out of 19,217 POs which took more than 3 days to release, 9,735 POs have rework.
Out of 19,217 POs which took more than 3 days to release, 1,006 are Service POs.
The POs taking more than 3 days from PO Creation to PO Release have a total PO value of INR 13 Billion.
The Avg. Cycle Time from PO Creation to PO Release for such POs is 15 Days 22 Hours, which is 43.04 % of the E2E Avg. Cycle Time.
The Avg. Cycle Time from PO Creation to PO Release (where PO Create to PO Release takes less than 3 days) is 1.77% of the E2E Avg. Cycle Time.
These POs with release time more than 3 days are catering to about 14,347 vendors.
The PO Plant 1070 has the highest number of cases (3,905) with PO Release time greater than 3 days.
The PO Type 'ZREL - HZL-Rel PO agst Conr' has the highest number of cases (11,223) with PO Release time greater than 3 days.
The POs where the Vendor Name is NULL  has the highest number of cases (4,870) with PO Release time greater than 3 days.
The Material Group PUMPS has the highest number of cases (4,212) with PO Release time greater than 3 days.
Hypothesis: It is costing us more money due to change in price by our supplier if we do not release POs within our standard SLA of up to 3 days.

) AS SUB

children.name: Breakdown by PO Release Cycle Time (> 3 Days)

dataSource.query:
SELECT
"PO Release Cycle Time Range",
"No. of Cases",
 "Total PO Amount (INR)",
 "Avg. Cycle Time"
FROM
(
 SELECT
  CASE 
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" <= DURATION '3days'THEN '0 - 3 Days'
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '3days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '5days' THEN '4 Days'
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '5days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '11days' THEN '5 - 10 Days'
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '11days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '16days' THEN '11 - 15 Days'
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '16days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '21days' THEN '16 - 20 Days'
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '21days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '31days' THEN '21 - 30 Days' 
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '31days' THEN 'More than 30 Days'
  ELSE 'Others'
  END AS "PO Release Cycle Time Range",
  CASE 
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" <= DURATION '3days'THEN 0
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '3days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '5days' THEN 1
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '5days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '11days' THEN 2
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '11days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '16days' THEN 3
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '16days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '21days' THEN 4
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '21days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '31days' THEN 5
  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" >= DURATION '31days' THEN 6
  ELSE 7
  END AS "Sequence No",
  COUNT("Case Id") AS "No. of Cases",
  SUM("PO Item Value") AS "Total PO Amount (INR)",
  AVG("Total Cycle Time") AS "Avg. Cycle Time"
  FROM
  (
   SELECT  
     DISTINCT
     CASE_ID AS "Case Id",
     "PO Item Net Order Value" AS "PO Item Value",
     ((SELECT LAST (END_TIME)) - (SELECT FIRST (END_TIME))) AS "Total Cycle Time",
     (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Release PO') - (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create PO Item') AS CYCLE_TIME
   FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
--   WHERE (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Release PO') - (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create PO Item') > DURATION '3DAYS'
  ) AS SUB1
  GROUP BY 1,2
  ORDER BY 2
) AS SUB2

Cases with PO Create to PO Release <= 3 Days
Case Details (PO Creation to PO Release > 3 Days) - No Cases with Blocked POs

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
"CASE_ID" AS "Case Id",
((SELECT LAST(END_TIME)) - (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME))) AS "Cycle Time",
((SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Release PO') - (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create PO Item')) AS "PO Create to PO Release Time",
(((SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Release PO') - (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create PO Item'))/((SELECT LAST(END_TIME)) - (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME))))*100 AS "PO Release Time as % of Cycle Time",

"PO Type",
"PO Item Material Group Text" AS "Material Group",
"PO Item Net Order Value" AS "PO Value (INR)",
"Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount Local Curr." AS "Inv. Amount (INR)"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Release PO') - (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create PO Item') > DURATION '3DAYS'
ORDER BY 3 DESC

children.name: PR Released (>120days)
Summary

blocks.text: 33,335 PRs have been released.
Out of these, 16,519 are in released stage and they have not progressed forward since 120 days.
Such PRs account up to 49.55% of the total released PRs and they have an Avg. Cycle Time 30 Days and 19 Hours.
Of the 16,519 PRs in Released Stage, 10,734 are of type 'HZL-Manual Req.' and 2,782 are of type 'HZL-Service PR'.
The PRs in released stage since 120 days have 590 variants and they have a Total Value of INR 85 Billion.
The PR Plant 3600 has the most No. of PRs in released stage since 30 days (3.174) and 1,595 out of them are for the PUMPS material group.

children.name: Delayed Payments (Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date)
Summary

blocks.text: Of the 11,002 paid invoices, 10,426 have been paid late.
This makes the percentage of invoices paid late as 94.77%.
A total of INR 10 Billion Invoice Amount has been paid late.
On an average, the No. of Days an Invoice Payment Delayed is 23.5% of the Avg. Cycle Time.
On an average, the No. of Days in which an Invoice Payment happens is 15.5% of the Avg. Cycle Time.
Avg. Cycle Time from Release PO to ASN is the highest 32 days.
Avg. Cycle Time from Release PR to Create PO is the second highest 28 days.
The PO Plant SINDESAR KHURD MINE  has the highest number of invoices paid late (2,029) and the highest Total Inv. Amount paid late (INR 4 Billion)
The Vendor Normet India Pvt Ltd has the highest number of invoices paid late (1,504) and the highest Total Inv. Amount paid late (INR 3.92 Billion)

children.name: Process Discovery - Normet India Private Ltd
Multiple POs for Same Purchase
PO Details - Multiple POs for Same Purchase - Primary Report

dataSource.query:
SELECT
--"PO Count",
--"Qualified PO Count",
"PO Id",
"PO Date",
"PO Material Group",
"Vendor Name",
"Avg. Cycle Time",
"PO Value (INR)",
"Total Purchase Amount (INR)"
FROM
(
SELECT
"PO Count",
COUNT("PO Id") OVER (PARTITION BY "PO Date","PO Material Group","Vendor Name") AS "Qualified PO Count",
"PO Id",
"PO Date",
"PO Material Group",
"Vendor Name",
"PO Value (INR)",
"Avg. Cycle Time",
"Total Purchase Amount (INR)"
FROM
(
 SELECT
 COUNT("PO Id") OVER (PARTITION BY "PO Date","PO Material Group","Vendor Name") AS "PO Count",
 SUM("PO Value (INR)") OVER (PARTITION BY "PO Date","PO Material Group","Vendor Name") AS "Total Purchase Amount (INR)",
 "PO Id",
 "PO Date",
 "PO Material Group",
 "Vendor Name",
 "PO Value (INR)",
 "Avg. Cycle Time"
 FROM
 (
  SELECT 
  "PO Id",
  DATE_TRUNC('Day',"PO Creation Date") AS "PO Date",
  "PO Item Material Group Text" AS "PO Material Group",
  "PO Vendor Name" AS "Vendor Name",
  SUM("PO Item Net Order Value") AS "PO Value (INR)",
  AVG((SELECT LAST(END_TIME)) - (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME))) AS "Avg. Cycle Time"
  FROM THIS_PROCESS
  GROUP BY 1,2,3,4
 ) AS SUB1
) AS SUB2
WHERE 
"PO Count" > 1
AND "PO Value (INR)" < 1000000
AND "Total Purchase Amount (INR)" > 999999
AND "Total Purchase Amount (INR)" < 1999999
ORDER BY 9 DESC,4 DESC
) AS SUB3
WHERE "Qualified PO Count" = "PO Count"

AND "Total Purchase Amount (INR)" < 1999999
--ORDER BY 9 DESC,4 DESC
) AS SUB3
WHERE "Qualified PO Count" = "PO Count"
ORDER BY 2 DESC, 3, 5

children.name: Invoices with Advance Payment

dataSource.query:
SELECT DISTINCT
CASE_ID AS "Case Id",
"PO Id" AS "PO Number",
"PO Item" AS "PO Line Item No",
"Last FI Invoice Id" AS "Invoice Number",
"Last FI Inv Vendor Number" AS "Vendor Number",
"Last FI Inv Vendor Name" AS "Vendor Name",
--"Event_Name" AS "Event Name",
(SELECT FIRST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Down Payment') AS "Down Payment Date",
(SELECT FIRST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Clear Invoice') AS "Invoice clearance Date",
--"PO Currency",
"PO Item Total Invoiced Net Amount Local Curr." AS "PO  Item Amount (INR)",
--"PO Item Hist Amount (Local Curr)" AS "Down Payment Amount (INR)",
(SELECT SUM("PO Item Hist Amount (Local Curr)") WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Down Payment') AS "Down Payment Amount (INR)",
--"PO Item Net Order Value",
--"PO Item Net Order Value in USD" * 79 AS "PO Item Net Order Value (INR)",
"Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount Local Curr." AS "Invoice Item Amount (INR)"
--"Last FI Invoice Item Invoice Amount for G/L" AS "Invoice Amoint GL (INR)",
--"Last FI Invoice Cash Discount Local Curr." AS "Invoice Discount Amount"--,
--"PO Item Hist Amount (Local Curr)" + "Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount Local Curr." AS TOTAL1
FROM THIS_PROCESS
--WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Down Payment'
ORDER BY 1,5

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
AVG((SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create Goods Receipt')
- (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Record Invoice Receipt'))
AS "Avg. Cycle Time"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date"

dataSource.query:
SELECT
--"Case Id",
"Invoice Number",
"Invoice Creation Date",
"Invoice Clearance Date",
"Vendor Name",
"Invoice Amount (INR)"
FROM
(SELECT
--"Case Id",
"Invoice Number",
"Invoice Creation Date",
"Invoice Clearance Date",
"Vendor Name",
"Invoice Amount (INR)",
COUNT("Invoice Number") OVER (PARTITION BY "PO Id","Invoice Creation Date","Last FI Inv Vendor Name","Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount Local Curr.") AS "Inv Count"
FROM
(
 SELECT DISTINCT 
--"CASE_ID" AS "Case Id",
  "PO Id",
  "PO Item",
  "Last FI Invoice Id" AS "Invoice Number",
  (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create FI Invoice') AS "Invoice Creation Date",
  (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Clear Invoice') AS "Invoice Clearance Date",
  "Last FI Inv Vendor Name" AS "Vendor Name",
  --((SELECT LAST(END_TIME)) - (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME))) AS "Cycle Time",
  "Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount Local Curr." AS "Invoice Amount (INR)"
 FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
) AS SUB1
)AS SUB2
WHERE "Inv Count" > 1
ORDER BY 4 DESC,1

 FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
 ORDER BY 3

properties.documentation:
After thePR is approved, the PR is allocated to a Buyer in Newgen. Once the PR is allocated in Newgen,the buyer will create an RFQ in SAP.

RFQ created based upon the Plant Code and PR number.
Sourcing request is automatically created in Ariba.
Approved PRs gets accumulated into a 2800 numbercreated in ARIBA.
RFQ number creates a Sourcing Project in ARIBA (can be for multiple PRs)
ARIBA ID is the WS3275... number
WS3275 = (1 RFQ + 1 or more PRs)
ARIBA = (2800 + PRs 1100)
Z_AR_RFQ is the name of the transaction, which is custom Z transaction
Program is called Z_AR_PR_TO_RFQ_SELCTION
Question:
Is this programbased on transactionME41 ?
Is this the Program used for RFQ creation. (Z_AR_PR_TO_RFQ_SELCTION)
properties.name: Create RFQ

properties.documentation:
Once a RFQ is created in SAP, aSourcing Request gets automatically created in Ariba with reference to the PR. Its value is concatenation of RFQ + PR (All PRs involved) + RFQ. This value can be edited manually.

Perform different tasks associated to a project. E.g. Sourcing and Negotiation, RFP, Awarding Phase, Project Closeout etc..

There is a WSXXXX number for each Sourcing Project which act as an identifier for the project and can becalled as Project Id.
properties.name: Update the task as completed to Create Sourcing Project

The approval workflow is based upon the selection of an approving plant for the initial project creation. Manual entry is also done sometimes.After the approvals are done at all the levels, the PO is pushed from Ariba to SAP.



The PO has to be released in the SAP system for it to be sent to the vendor.
